p: Generally, acetic acid-induced writhing test serves as a standard technique for evaluating antinociceptive/analgesic efficacy of natural products [ 31, 32]. In this method, acetic acid induces the release of various endogenous noxious mediators such as histamine, serotonin, and bradykinin which drive the cardinal signs associated with inflammation, especially pain [ 27]. The pain brought by the acetic acid is evidenced in the contraction of abdominal muscles and the expansion of forelimbs, as well as body elongation, that is generally regarded as writhing, whose frequency is quantified in 30â€‰minutes [ 7, 27]. This elongation is thought to be caused by the activation of local peritoneal receptors and prostaglandin pathways in the experimental model animal, by appropriate chemicals like acetic acid [ 33].
